ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course helps a lot with conversational Chinese.
My Chinese ability has improved vastly over this course, I feel especially more comfortable speaking!
Chinese language skills, culture, and tradition
Various skills in Chinese, with great emphasis on speaking and pronunciation, as well as reading and writing skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: excellent balance between grammar and vocabulary. Weaknesses: During the second written test not enough time was provided.
The teachers, especially Sun Laoshi, we so dedicated, kind, and enthusiastic. The workload it high, but the expectation are clear and it's a really fun course in retrospect!
The course is extremely well planned out, the combination of listening and speaking listens with the written text book is great.

Strengths include the teachers' engagement with the students and proficiency in teaching. The class can be improved by employing a better textbook that engages with an economic and cultural aspect of China. Oral tests could also be better structured.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would: compared to Chinese 110-120 the course is much more lively. This comes partly as a result of greater knowledge among the students. However the activities and material more accessible more accessible than that of the introductory courses.
Absolutely - be aware it's a big time commitment, but your Chinese will improve greatly.
Absolutely, if you're interested in learning Chinese, take this course!
Great class to improve your Chinese skills thoroughly.
